snippet: The Syrian leadership may be calculating that it can resort to such lethal arms without fear of intervention partly because Washington has set its “red line” at the use of chemical weapons.
abstract: Obama administration officials say Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's forces are firing ballistic missiles at rebel fighters inside the country, escalating civil war as the government struggles to slow momentum of gaining insurgency; State Department officials assert that Assad forces have, for the first time, fired at least six Soviet-designed Scud missiles in the latest bid to push back rebels.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mark Landler from Washington; Aida Alami from Marrakesh, Morocco; Alan Cowell from London; Anne Barnard, Hwaida Saad and Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon; and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: The Syrian leadership may be calculating that it can resort to such lethal arms without fear of intervention partly because Washington has set its “red line” at the use of chemical weapons.

headline.seo: Assad Fires Scuds at Rebels, U.S. Says, Escalating War in Syria
headline.main: Syria Uses Scud Missiles in New Effort to Push Back Rebels
headline.print_headline: Missile Attack on Rebels Escalates the War in Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
